Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CPF-AM1 (caerulein precursor fragment-AM1, Leu-rich; natural AMPs; UCLL1c; frogs, amphibians, animals; XXA; BBL)

Literature Information.Literature: Active against E. coli ATCC 25726 (MIC 12.5 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 6.25 uM), A. baumannii (MIC 2-8 uM),  S. maltophilia (MIC 2-8 uM), and K. pneumoniae (MIC 25 uM).  The peptide can bind to LPS (McLean et al., 2014). The original S9-P18 has been replaced. Updated 7/2020
Literature Information.Author:
Conlon JM, Al-Ghaferi N, Ahmed E, Meetani MA, Leprince J, Nielsen PF.

 2010
Literature Information.Title: Orthologs of magainin, PGLa, procaerulein-derived, and proxenopsin-derived peptides from skin secretions of the octoploid frog Xenopus amieti (Pipidae).
